item.title: Report E-2025060416
item.description:
Report E-2025060416

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-18
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On June 19, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1760 was punctured and released approximately 135-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. HES personnel deployed neutralizing, granular absorbents to the released product, worked them in, and collected the spent absorbents with hand tools. The contents of the damaged tote were transferred into one (1) new 275-gallon tote. The damaged tote was cut up for waste. All impacted materials were containerized in six (6) 55-gallon drums.

item.description:
Report E-2025070074

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8800
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver overfilled the customer's storage tank. This allowed approximately 200 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. ERC Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
